segments.text: What a mess in this kitchen; I can't believe my eyes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is full to the brim, water spilling everywhere like nobody cares.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That woman is just drying a plate, ignoring the flood at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her apron's probably soaked, and she's oblivious—how careless!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Dishes stacked nearby could get ruined if she slips.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And those kids— the boy on the tilting stool, raiding the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's going to break his neck or make an even bigger mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl egging him on, reaching for treats without permission.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Open cabinets, unstable stool— this is reckless parenting or something.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The peaceful garden view mocks the disaster unfolding inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to turn off that faucet and supervise these brats.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm fuming just watching this negligence.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The towel she's using won't dry anything if the water keeps coming.
segments.speaker: PAR
